name: Parody and Comedy in Early Modern Spanish Literature
description: Parody and comedy as interrelated literary forms that create humour through conventional character types, the play of language, self-conscious imitation, and the relationship of parodic works to canonical intertexts. Considerations of humour as a response to social anxieties in early modern Spain. Analysis of poems, plays and short prose narratives by representative authors; Garcilaso, GÃ³ngora, Quevedo, Tirso de Molina, Cervantes.
prerequisites: SPA120Y1 or SPA220Y1 or SPA219Y1 or permission of the Department
